CONJUGATES: ace (n.sg) | aces (n.pl) | ace (v.base) | aces (v.3sg) | acing (v.pres.p) | aced (v.past/p.p)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, from Old French as 'a unit, a single point (on a die)', from Latin as 'unity, a unit, a coin'. The sense of 'highest playing card' emerged in the late 15th century. The sense of 'expert' developed in the early 20th century, notably from World War I fighter pilots.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A playing card with a single spot, typically the highest-ranking card in a suit.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 扑克牌中的A牌，通常为同花色中点数最大的一张。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She drew an ace of spades from the deck.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她从牌堆里抽到了一张黑桃A。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who is highly skilled or proficient at a particular activity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在某项活动中技艺高超或精通的人；高手。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: informal adjective, usually attributive or predicative
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: That was an ace meal we had last night.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们昨晚吃的那顿饭棒极了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To perform very well in (a test, exam, or other challenge); to pass with an excellent grade.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在（考试、比赛或其他挑战中）表现出色；以优异成绩通过。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She studied hard and aced all her final exams.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她努力学习，所有的期末考试都得了A。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (In tennis) a serve that the opponent is unable to return; (in golf) a hole in one.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （网球）发球直接得分；（高尔夫）一杆进洞。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The tennis player served three aces in a row.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位网球选手连续发了三个Ace球。
